description: RETENTION OF 1 X AIR CONDITIONING UNIT AND 2 X AIR SOURCE HEAT PUMP TO THE REAR OF THE PROPERTY TOGETHER WITH 2 X AIR CONDITIONING UNITS ON THE NORTHERN SIDE FLANK ELEVATION.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Covering letter; SAA Ltd, Noise Impact Assessment Report dated September 2023, Ref SA-7474/Rev2; PP01; PP02; PR01; PR03; PR04; PR05; PR07; PR08 Proposed Elevation Side 1; PR08 Proposed Elevation Side 2; PR09.

Condition : 3 - Due to potential impact on the surrounding locality from the development the recommendations, mitigation measures and criteria to protect noise impact on the surrounding noise sensitive properties as specified in the SAA Ltd, Noise Impact Assessment Report dated September 2023, Ref SA-7474/Rev2, shall be implemented within 3 months of the planning permission hereby permitted, and maintained as a minimum standard. A post completion noise survey shall be undertaken within 3 months of the above installation to demonstrate compliance with the criteria outlined in the report and this shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 

Reason
In the interests of neighbour amenity. To comply with Policy D14 of the London Plan 2021 and Policy DM D2 of the Site and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 4 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.
